summary: The Gift Accountability, Reporting, and Disclosures Act (GARD Act) amends section 7342 of title 5, United States Code, concerning the reporting of foreign gifts and decorations received by federal employees. It expands the definition of individuals required to report, updates reporting procedures, and increases transparency by requiring public access to gift listings. The act also introduces a late fee for delayed filings and mandates that agencies adapt systems for public access.
